alert.note: Alert for Asotin; Garfield (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 5:11PM PDT until August 26 at 8:15PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The burn scar in... Southwestern Asotin County in southeastern Washington... Southeastern Garfield County in southeastern Washington... * Until 815 PM PDT. * At 511 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the burn scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the drainages for Asotin Creek, Charley and Lick Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the burn scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the burn scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wickiup Campground and Misery Spring Campground. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
